Key Match Events: Braves rally for four runs in the 10th inning after blowing a four-run lead.
Raisel Iglesias' strong ninth inning performance after a shaky eighth.

Pre-Game Insights: Braves led 4-0 going into the seventh inning thanks to home runs by Michael Harris II and Marcell Ozuna.
Twins tied the game in the eighth inning against Raisel Iglesias, ending his streak.
Brian Snitker emphasized the importance of the win after a costly loss.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Brian Snitker praised the team's resilience and clutch performance.
Travis d'Arnaud was highlighted as a key player in the 10th inning rally.
Marcell Ozuna credited d'Arnaud's approach in high-pressure situations.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Game was played at Target Field in Minneapolis.
Jhoan Duran, Twins' closer, threw hard but struggled in the 10th inning.
Braves have won five of their last six games and are preparing for a series against the Phillies.
Others: Atlanta's ability to handle pressure and adapt to Twins' pitching.
Braves' depth and resilience despite injuries.
